Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 11th overall pick, by Boston (UBA) in 1966...
Traded from Boston (UBA) to Plum Grove on 3/2/1966 (Going to PG: SS G. Mcbee. Going to PIL: LF J. Adams)...
Injured on 6/6/1966 with a Hyper Extended Elbow, out for 1-2 weeks...
Injured on 4/17/1972 with a Bruised Heel, out for 4 days...
Had first career hit on 6/6/1973, off Nick Beaufort (NE)...
Hit first career homerun on 6/25/1973, off Sam Malone (WIS)...
Drove in 7 runs against Boston (FBA) on 5/21/1974...
Was selected to the 1975 Allstar game...
Drove in 6 runs against Malibu on 4/19/1977...
Hit for the cycle against Bay City on 5/15/1977...
Was selected to the 1977 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 8/18/1977, hitting .462 with 3 HR, 13 RBI...
Drove in 7 runs against Northeastern on 6/9/1978...
Signed as a free agent by Malibu on 2/4/1979 to a 3-year deal worth $3,000,000 per year...
Signed as a free agent by Gashouse on 2/1/1982 to a 3-year deal worth $1,250,000 per year...
